name: photovoltaic mounting system production, for 570kWp open ground module | photovoltaic mounting system, for 570kWp open ground module | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9561/documentation

This datasets represents the installation of the mounting system needed for the open ground mounting of 1 m2 PV panel.

This dataset starts from the purchase of the needed components for the photovoltaic open ground mounting system. 

This dataset includes land use of the open ground power plant, packaging materials and the protection fence materials.

This dataset doesn't include the electricity use for erection of the mounting system as this is allocated to the PV plant dataset. The life cycle inventory of the production of mounting systems does not take into account process emissions such as dust, because information is not available.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Mounting system for an open ground photovoltaic power plant. Most open ground systems have a foundation of profiles that are piled into the ground. However, in some cases, where piled profiles cannot be used, such as for photovoltaic power plants on sanitary landfills, a concrete foundation is installed. Here, piling is chosen as reference operation.;;Weight of the mounting system: 10.37 kg/m2

exchanges.description: EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Literature value/Estimation. The total area of PV modules used in the large PV power plants is not calculated from the cell efficiency, but corresponds to the actual situation at the power plants investigated. The land use related to an open ground mounting system is 4.7 m2 per m2 of installed modules, based on information about a 3.5 MWp open ground power plant described by Mason et al. (2006) and a 560 kWp open ground power plant described by Frischknecht et al. (1996) 
 
[Frischknecht R., Bollens U., Bosshart S., Ciot M., Ciseri L., Doka G., Dones R., Gantner U., Hischier R. and Martin A. (1996) Ökoinventare von Energiesyste-men: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. 3. Gruppe Energie - Stoffe - Umwelt (ESU), Eidgenössische Technische Hochschule Zürich und Sektion Ganzheitliche Systemanalysen, Paul Scherrer Institut, Villigen, Bundesamt für Energie (Hrsg.), Bern, CH, retrieved from: www.energieforschung.ch.]

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Literature value / estimation. According to Daniel Fraile Montoro from EPIA all ground-mounted PV systems have a fence because of the insurance and the risk of high voltage access. He states that there are many different types of fences, but as a normal one a two meters meshed fence with some wire on the top could be considered [Personal communication with Daniel Fraile Montoro from the European Photovoltaic Industry Associa-tion, 17.11.2009].  For the inventory of such a fence, we consider the steel, zinc, and concrete input. The steel is drawn to wire and the zinc is used for a coils coating.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Literature value / estimation. According to Daniel Fraile Montoro from EPIA all ground-mounted PV systems have a fence because of the insurance and the risk of high voltage access. He states that there are many different types of fences, but as a normal one a two meters meshed fence with some wire on the top could be considered [Personal communication with Daniel Fraile Montoro from the European Photovoltaic Industry Associa-tion, 17.11.2009].  For the inventory of such a fence, we consider the steel, zinc, and concrete input. The steel is drawn to wire and the zinc is used for a coils coating.
